artist_display:

Greek, active in Spain, 1541–1614
title: Saint Martin and the Beggar

title: Daisies

(Victoria and Albert Museum, 1945), cat. 26 (ill.), as Marguerites. Isabelle Monod-Fontaine, Matisse: Oeuvres de Henri Matisse (1869–1954), Collections du Musée national d’art moderne (Centre Georges Pompidou, Musée national d’art moderne, 1979), p. 70, as Marguerites, l’été 1939. Art Institute of Chicago, Art Institute of Chicago Annual Report, 1982–83, with a report by James Wood and E. Laurence Chalmers, Jr. (Art Institute of Chicago, 1983), pp. 6, fig. 7; 20; 48, as Les Marguerites (The Daisies), 1939. “Acquisitions,” Mosaic (July/Aug. 1983), p. 8, as Les Marguerites, 1939. Catherine C. Bock, “Woman before an Aquarium and Woman on a Rose Divan: Matisse in the Helen Birch Bartlett Memorial Collection,” “The Helen Birch Bartlett Memorial Collection,” special issue, Art Institute of Chicago Museum Studies 12, no. 2 (1986), p. 218, n. 2, Daisies (Marguerites), 1939. Isabelle Monod-Fontaine, Anne Baldassari, and Claude Laugier, Matisse: Œuvres de Henri Matisse, Collections du musée national d’art moderne (Éditions du Centre Pompidou, 1989), p. 92, fig. c, as Fleurs et figures, pot arabe, 16 juillet 1939 and mi-juillet 1939. artist_display:
Marc Chagall
French, born Vitebsk, Russia (present-day Belarus), 1887–1985
title: America Windows

title: Reminiscence of a Cathedral

title: Bathers by a River

artist_display:
Giorgio de Chirico
Italian, born Greece, 1888–1978
title: The Philosopher's Conquest
publication_history:

title: Picture of Dorian Gray
publication_history: "The Albright Twins Paint Gruesome Masterpieces in an Abandoned Methodist Church,” Life, March 2, 1944, 63–70. The Art Digest, May 14, 1945, 14. C.J. Bulliet, “Albright’s ‘Dorian Gray’ Hollywoodian in its Horror,” Chicago Daily News, July 28, 1945. “A Look at the Albrights,” Newsweek, Nov. 5, 1945, 106. Harriet and Sidney Janis, “The Painting of Ivan Albright,” Art in America, Jan. 1946, 43–49. “By the Way,” Townsfolk, Chicago, 35, 1 (1946). Dorothy Bridaham, “The Paintings of Ivan Albright,” Chicago, April 1954, 20–41, ill. p. 21. Ralph M. Pearson, The Modern Renaissance in American Art (Harper and Brothers, 1954), 237, 239, fig. 146. WFMT Fine Arts Guide, Chicago, Nov. 1960, ill. back cover. Edith Weigle, “The Genius of Ivan Albright, Chicago Tribune Magazine, January 27, 1963. Robert Hardy Andrews, “Some Stories That Didn’t Get Into My Book,” Chicago Daily News, Summer 1963. “I Wish to Create Tension and Conflict,” Chicago Daily News, Panorama Section, Oct. 24, 1964, ill. Edward Barry, “Big Albright Exhibit – Tribute to Chicagoan,” Chicago Tribune, Oct. 25, 1964. “Ivan Albright,” Arts, March 1965, 55–56. Peter Fox Smith, “Vermont’s Hidden Master,” Sunday Boston Globe magazine, Feb. 8, 1976, 18–29. Jan Van der Marck, “Ivan Albright: More than Meets the Eye,” Art in America, Nov./Dec. 1977, 93–98. Alan G. Artner, “At 81, Ivan Albright Enjoys his Gift of Second Sight,” Chicago Tribune, Oct. 22, 1978. Michael Croydon, Ivan Albright (New York: Abbeville Press, 1978), 112–14, 123, pls. 38–39. Louise Bruner, “The Chicago Art Scene: Albright Returns Home,” The Blade, Toledo Ohio, Octo. 29, 1978, ill. “Joshua Kind, Reassessing Albright,” The New Art Examiner, Dec. 1978, 10–11. Ed Lion, “Albright Doesn’t Use Words Beautiful, Ugly,” Sarasota Herald–Tribune (UPI), Tues., Dec. 19, 1978, Sec. C, 1. “America: Traum und Depression 1920/1940,” Neue Gesellschaft fur bilende Kunst, Berlin, Nov. 9–Dec. 28, 1980, b/w ill. in exh. cat. although work was not included in the show, 277. “Ivan Albright,” The New Renaissance, 4, 3, 14 (Spring 1981), 31–40, ill. p. 37. Michael Brenson, “Ivan Albright, 86, Painter, is Dead", New York Times, Nov. 19, 1983, 33, ill. James Martinez, “Artist Albright, the ‘Master of Decay,’ is Dead", Chicago Sun–Times, Nov. 19, 1983, ill. Christopher Lyon, “Synthetic Realism: Albright, Golub, Paschke,” Art Journal (Winter 1985), 330–333, ill. p. 332. Henry Canter, “Modern Work Shown at Arts and Letters,” The Uptown Dispatch, New York, Dec. 6–19, 1985, 13, ill. Arte American 1930–1970, Independent Curators Inc., 1991, ill. Judith A. Barter et al., American Modernism at the Art Institute of Chicago, From World War I to 1955, (Chicago: Art Institute of Chicago/Yale University Press, 2009), cat. 92. The Andy Warhol Foundation, Sally King–Nero, Neil Printz, The Andy Warhol Catalogue Raisonné: Paintings and Sculpture late 1974–1976, (Phaidon Press, 2014), vol. 4, (ill.). Sarah Kelly Oehler, ed., Ivan Albright Paintings at the Art Institute of Chicago (Chicago: Art Institute of Chicago, 2019), https://www.artic.edu/digitalalbright, cat. 18 (ill.).
